Insane

  • Insanity can be short-term, long-term, or indefinite.
  • Short-term insanity lasts for 1d10 minutes.
  • Long-term insanity lasts for 1d10 x 10 hours.
  • Indefinite insanity gains a new character flaw until cured.
Short-Term Insanity

d100

Effect (lasts 1d10 minutes)

01-10

The character falls unconscious.

11-20

The character retreats into its mind and becomes paralyzed. The effect ends if the character takes any damage.

21-30

The character becomes deathly frightened, and must use its action and movement to flee from the source of the fear.

31-40

The character begins babbling uncontrollably and cannot speak or cast spells with vocal components.

41-50

The character must use his or her action each round to attack the nearest creature.

51-60

The character begins seeing vivid hallucinations and has disadvantage on skill checks.

61-70

The character’s mind partially shuts down and just does whatever anyone tells it.

71-80

The character is stunned.

81-90

The character becomes incapacitated and spends the duration babbling, weeping, laughing, or screaming.

91-100

The creature feels drained of energy and depressed, falling prone and becoming restrained.
